lead_paragraph: Mexico’s National Human Rights Commission said that a new autopsy had determined that the student suffered 64 fractures in 40 bones, mostly in his skull, face and spine.

headline.print_headline: Panel Says Classmate of Students Missing in Mexico Was Tortured
headline.main: Classmate of Students Who Disappeared in Mexico Was Tortured, Panel Says

snippet: Mexico’s National Human Rights Commission said that a new autopsy had determined that the student suffered 64 fractures in 40 bones, mostly in his skull, face and spine....
abstract: Autopsy of Mexican student Julio Cesar Mondragon's body reveals that he was tortured by his captors and died from brain injuries; Mondragon was one of 43 college students who disappeared in Iguala, Mexico, in 2014.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
